message:
Hi all,
Just released our private beta of Sparkwall and we would love to hear your feedback! 

Sparkwall is a visual collaboration tool that helps remote dev and creative teams communicate by sharing designs in real time.  The app is built on node.js, socket.io and MongoDB using Amazon EC2 and S3 for hosting and storage.

Invitation Code: HACKERNEWS 
Sign up: http://sparkwall.me

Thanks
Johan Ekhager Co-founder / CTO
Looks pretty cool...just signed up for a beta invite.
You've got an invite!
@johanekhager Thanks :)
I also signed up.  Can't wait to see how this works, been looking for something like this for a while.
There's no delete functionality of lines, words, etc, in a wall, is there?
go to http://sparkwall.me/sign-up and type HACKERNEWS on invite code field! :)
You can delete, just mark the object and click on backspace or delete button
signed up. looks interesting. might be cool for my students
Thanks! Guess I've looked at the rotating thing too much that I freaked out when I did set the speed. Will slow it down asap!
We're interested in using this tool for students. We got a few beta testers at universities in Sweden now, and will try it at some universities in US next month.
Great video! I think what really helped me understand it was by viewing the pictures with text below the too-fast-rotating thing at the top.
Cool! I'm just signed up.
Nice! please share your thoughts! :-)
Still too fast rotating on slider at http://sparkwall.me?
is there a way to delete a couple of items at once?
Yes, actually (it's kind of a ninjafeature :P). Hold shift and click on those items you want to delete, and then hit deletebutton.
This could be good for way more people than just devs and designers.  I would just market it as a visual collaboration app.
wat the hell out there
@philipscuong Wat wat? :)

@coleman Thank you for your thoughts! We wanted to focus at one or a few markets during beta, just to keep focus on something :) A thought, do you think it would be OK to market it as a visual collaboration app without some kind of voice functionality?
Very cool product! Keep up the good work! Got my invite pretty fast :)
@johanekhager Hmm, yeah, I guess it would be a little weird to have visual collaboration without audio
can you slow down the slider on the home page? I'm not a ninja reader :-)
@coleman I agree. People still using Skype or similar products for voice though. But maybe should team up with a voice-service if we go for that kind of market.
@barcelonaFC haha, ofc :) I must be too used to watch the slider, will slow it down! Thx :)
